intro: Sclarea triloba, commonly known as the three-lobed angelica, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, often pungent foliage. The plant features compound leaves with three distinct lobes, giving it its common name, and produces small, clustered white or greenish flowers. Its roots are thick and fleshy, often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Sclarea triloba thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas.
